result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ernest Lerma III was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:46 a.m.  Andrew Christenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ernest Lerma in court with attorney Walter Arthur Piel.   

Statement by DA Christenson - goes over agreement.  Defendant will plea to count 1.  Count 2 dismissed.  Traffic citations dismissed.  3 years IC and 3 years ES.  $600 plus costs.  3 year DL revocation.  IID for 3 years.  Prison eligibility.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant.   Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Dismiss count 2 and 14TR83 and 14TR84.  Judgment be entered today.  State and defense counsel waive PSI.  DA makes sentencing recommendation.  Agreement by Atty Piel.  Defendant makes statement.

Court sentences the defendant to:

3 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

$600 fine plus Court costs
D.L. revocation for 3 years
IID for 3 years
AODA
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent
Defendant is eligible for CIP and ERP.
Court does not order any jail credit at this time.
Defendant is immediately remanded to custody

Court adjourned at 8:56 a.m.
Plaintiff
from Atty Walter Piel dated December 17, 2014 requesting the jury trial be rescheduled.

3:56 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Walter Piel.  Scott Blader as Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Piel, defendant will accept the offer and requests matter be set for plea & sentencing in 60 days.  Court will set for plea & sentencing in 60 days.

3:33 p.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present with Attorney Walter Piel.

Michael Prachel sworn, direct by DA.  Employed with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department and so employed on January 19, 2014.  Venue established.  Goes over the date in question.  Stipulation as to the identification of the defendant.  State's exhibit #1 - Crime Lab Report.  DA offers exhibit #1 - no objection - received by the court.  State's exhibit #2 - Certified driving record of defendant.  No objection by Attorney Piel - received by the court.  Cross examination by Attorney Piel.  

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony has been committed and finds probable cause that the felony was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Piel.  Attorney Piel confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 3:49 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Statement by Attorney Piel  - requests a preliminary hearing be scheduled.  Court directs preliminary hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 3:46 p.m.
Status hearing on May 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
from Atty Walter Piel Jr - requests status hearing scheduled on May 5, 2014 be rescheduled or permission to appear via telephone

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to drive a motor vehicle unless he has a valid drivers license.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to drive a motor vehicle unless he has a valid drivers license.

11:26 a.m.  State by Special Prosecutor Chuck Stertz.  Defendant present with Attorney Walter Piel.

Attorney Piel confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding maximum/minimum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.  

Court orders bond set at $5,000.00 signature bond with the conditions of:  Maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Not drive a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

Attorney Piel waives the time limits as to the Preliminary.  Court directs Status Hearing regarding Preliminary Hearing be held in approximately thirty days.
